intro: Clibadium harlingii, commonly known as the Harling's sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Clibadium harlingii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
